column4: Are there free email clients for linux that use http protocols?
Does any linux email support http protocol (rather than pop or imap)?
there are ways you can grab httpmail
http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-22152.html
thanks :0
what account do you want to read with httpmail?
if you run: sudo lshw -C network   you will see the chip used, the make / model is moot.
you can use the chip make / model to find guides
if it's usb based you can use: lsusb   and websearch the 8 character hex id to find guides
boot to root recovery mode and run: passwd foo ,change foo for your username. Reboot and login as foo with the password you set
you are a saint!  Thanks very much.
youcan get root recovery by holding shift at boot, select recovery mode, select root
Thanks very much - that worked like a dream :)
nice way to fix stuff when it goes mental.
try:  file /usr/bin/\[
in what way?
there are some controls in ccsm
run:  system-config-printing
use TAB to complete the command
is it a data dvd or a video dvd?
then it doesn't need mounting
in VLC you can click file -> play disk
you will have obviously needed to install the DVD decoder
